thread.title: Antonio Brown tweets negative scouting report that labeled him marginal NFL prospect
thread.title_full: Antonio Brown tweets negative scouting report that labeled him marginal NFL prospect

author: Arthur Weinstein (awperform@gmail.com)
title: Antonio Brown tweets negative scouting report that labeled him marginal NFL prospect
text:
February 27, 2017 7:19pm EST February 27, 2017 7:18pm EST American Football, News, English, Antonio Brown, NFL, Pittsburgh Steelers Antonio Brown's scouting report said he lacked "functional strength," ran poor routes, had concentration lapses and "character concerns." Antonio Brown (Getty Images) 
Updated at 7:19  19 p.m. ET 
On the day Antonio Brown signed a long-term contract that will make him the highest-paid wide receiver in the NFL, the Steelers receiver still had an axe to grind â€” over a 7-year-old scouting report that labeled him a marginal NFL prospect. 
Not long after Brown signed a four-year, $68 million extension Monday afternoon, he tweeted out a screen shot of a 2010 scouting report that questioned his size, strength, route running, concentration and character. 
In fact, about the only nice thing the scouting report had to say is that Brown didn't miss a game in his three seasons at Central Michigan. 6th Round. 195th overall.
